page.title: 08Village Hall In Notgrove
page.content: The Notgrove Village Hall is a prefabricated building situated in the centre of the village. It was purchaced second hand and erected in 1958. Tuesday evening is social club night, where members can play darts or have a drink and a chat, as the hall is licensed for the sale of alcoholic beverages. Whist Drives are held monthly, with 10 tables in use. Discos are arranged periodicaly for the young members. The Cricket Club uses the hall for teas when matches are at home. The hall has 20 to 30 private party lettings each year. In the Autumn a party is given by the owners of the Notgrove Estate to all the Estate workers and a few invited guests. The annual Produce Show is held on August Bank Holiday Monday. The hall is a local meeting place and is well used by the villagers.
